intro: Licania tocantina, commonly known as the Tocantins licania, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
